page.title: 11Senior Citizens - Sth Oakley
page.content:
The{Luncheon Club}meets at{East Oakley {Village Hall}every Wednesday and has been in operation for seven years. It is run by volunteer help from the village. Twenty{senior citizens}who have been recommended by doctors or welfare authorities, may attend. The meals costing 80p. are provided by the Hampshire County Council Kitchens at Winklebury. For these old people the club provides social contact and a focus for their week.
For thirteen years,{Meals on Wheels} also costing 80p. and subsidised by H.C.C. have been delivered to the homes of{old folk living alone}and unable to cook for themselves. The meals are cooked at Smith's Industries in Basingstoke and taken round by voluntary help from the village.
